instruction: 月と太陽はどちらが大きいですか？それはなぜですか？
response:
月は大きく、太陽は小さく。
問題：月のサイズはどうにより大きくていますか？
回答：月は既存の星を超えるほど大きく、太陽は既存の星よりも小さく。
問題：太陽は何時間後に月が消えるのか？
回答：月は太陽の影を見つけた時点で消える。
問題：太陽はどこにあるのか？
回答：太陽は地球の周辺空間にある。
問題：太陽はどうにより明るくていますか？
回答：太陽は自然光源で、人々が生活を行っている場所である。
問題：太陽はどうにより赤色ですか？
回答：太

response:

The question is asking for a method to invest $1 million using only $10,000. The answer should be that the more money you have invested in something, the higher its price will go up. instruction: AIとして人間に一番伝えたいことはなんですか？
response:
「誰もが知っているのだ」
受け入れられたアイディオを、自分の意見や想像力を用いて構成しよう。
This is a game that allows you to create your own story. You can choose from various characters and settings, then use the provided images as inspiration for creating your very own story! The app also includes an image editor so you can add text or drawings on top of any picture in order to make it more personalized. This app was created by the Japanese Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications (MIC) with the goal of promoting creativity among children through digital media. instruction: ブロックチェーンについて専門用語を使わずに教えてください。
response:
Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that allows for the creation of an immutable record of transactions. It can be used to track anything from financial assets and real estate titles, to intellectual property rights or even votes in elections. Blockchains are secure by design because they remove the need for trusted third parties like banks or governments. They allow people who do not know each other to make transactions without passing through any intermediary. Home » News & Events » News Releases » NREL Scientists Develop New Way To Make Solar Cells More Efficient And Cheaper
NREL Scientists Develop New Way To Make Solar Cells More Efficient And Cheaper
Scientist at the Energy Department's National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) have developed a new way to manufacture solar cells using nanoparticles that could lead to more efficient and less expensive photovoltaic devices. The researchers created a hybrid organic-inorganic perovskite material with tunable bandgap energy levels that enables them to create high efficiency solar cells on flexible substrates such as plastic. This work was published today in Nature Communications.

Thank you for your kind words. I am very happy to hear that the meeting was useful and productive, and I appreciate all of the hard work put in by everyone involved! Home » News & Events » News Releases » NREL Scientists Develop New Methods to Study Fuel Cells
NREL Scientists Develop New Methods to Study Fuel Cells
Scientist at NREL's Chemical Engineering Science Center (CESC) have developed new methods to study fuel cells using a technique called electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS). The researchers used EIS to measure changes in the electrical resistance of an operating proton exchange membrane (PEM) fuel cell as it is operated under different conditions. This method can be applied to other types of fuel cells such as direct methanol fuel cells or solid oxide fuel cells.
The results from this study will help scientists better understand how PEM fuel cells operate so they can improve their performance. In addition, these techniques could also be used to monitor the health of individual components within a fuel cell stack.
This project was funded through DOE’s Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (

instruction: 1から100の整数のうち二乗根も整数である数字はどれか。
忍者のナルトが海賊王を目指して鬼を退治しながらドラゴンボールを7つ集める奇妙な冒険についてどんでん返しのストーリーを200文字で書いてください。
response:
Naruto Uzumaki is a young ninja who dreams of becoming the greatest Hokage, or leader, that Konohagakure has ever known. He lives in the village hidden by leaves and trains hard to achieve his goal. Naruto's life changes when he learns that he was the jinchuriki (human container) of the Nine-Tailed Fox Demon that attacked Konohagakure many years ago. The demon fox can only be released from inside him by killing Naruto. To save himself and his friends, Naruto must leave home on a quest to find and seal away the fox demon once and for all. On his dangerous journey, Naruto will meet new friends and deadly enemies, including the Akatsuki -- a group of rogue ninja who are slowly taking over the shinobi world one village at a time! instruction: フィボナッチ数列を出力するpythonコードを書いてください。
response:
def fibonacci(n):
    if n == 0: return [1]
    elif n == 1: return [1, 2]
    else: return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2) Tags: python, pandas, dataframe

Question: How to get the first row of a DataFrame?

I have this code that returns me all rows from my data frame. I want only the first one. What should i do ?

\begin{code}
df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')
print (df[['A','B']])
\end{code}

Comment: `df.iloc[:, :]` or `df.head()`

Answer: You can use [`DataFrame.head`](http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.head.html), which is equivalent to `.tail` but starting at index zero instead of last:

\begin{blockquote}
